title: Building Learning Applications with Tsugi
description: These tutorials walk through the various topics and exercises to learn how to develop with Tsugi.  If you login and do the exercises you will earn Mozilla Open Badges.

modules.title: Overview of Tsugi
modules.description: This gives some context around what Tsugi is and why Tsugi is being developed.

modules.title: Building Web Applications
modules.description: Pre-Requisite: If you don't know how to use PHP, MySQL, and JavaScript, to build web applications, we recommend you take the on-line course called 'Web Applications for Everybody'.

modules.title: Installing PHP and SQL
modules.description: The first task is to work through the installation steps including installing a text editor, installing MAMP or XAMPP (or equivalent), creating a MySql Database, and writing a PHP program.  There are separate instructions for (1) Macintosh, (2) Windows, and (3) Bash on Windows-10.

videos.title: Installing MAMP on Macintosh for PHP/MySQL
Installing XAMPP on Windows for PHP/MySQL
Installing PHP and MySQL using bash on Windows-10

references.title: Bonus: Brian Behlendorf on the Apache Software Foundation

json.title: Installing PHP/MySQL
json.description: This assignment is designed to show that you have successfully installed a PHP/MySQL environment.  This assignment is worth 10 points. 4 points come from your peers and 2 points come from you grading other student's submissions and 4 points come from the instructor review of your assignment .
json.grading: This is a relatively simple assignment.  Don't take off points for little mistakes.  If they seem to have done the assignment give them full credit.   Feel free to make suggestions if there are small mistakes.  Please keep your comments positive and useful.  If you do not take grading seriously, the instructors may delete your response and you will lose points.

modules.title: Installing Tsugi
modules.description: The first task is to work through the installation steps including installing a text editor, installing MAMP or XAMPP (or equivalent), creating a MySql Database, and writing a PHP program.

modules.title: Building the Attendance Tool
modules.description: This is a series of videos about developing a Tsugi tool in PHP.  You should watch the first two videos before watching videos 3-5 so you understand how a tool functions within Tsugi and how the Tsugi APIs are set up and function.  Video 3 covers the Silex framework, video 4 covers Handlebars, and video 5 shows a single page Tsugi Application using the tmpljs templating language.

videos.title: Looking at the Tsugi APIs in A Tsugi Tool
Building a Tsugi tool in Silex
Building a Tsugi tool using Handlebars
Building a single page Tsugi tool using tmpljs
